decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing title number(s): 21.160.PP3a.OS (Existing Location and Block Plan), 20.160.100 (Existing Site Plan), 21.160.201 (Existing Basement Floor Plan), 21.160.202 (Existing Ground Floor Plan), 21.160.203 (Existing First Floor Plan), 21.160.204 (Existing Second Floor Plan), 21.160.205 (Existing Roof Plan), 21.160.206 (Existing Section AA), 21.160.207 (Existing Section BB), 21.160.208 (Existing Front Elevation), 21.160.209 (Existing Rear Elevations), 21.160.210 (Existing East Elevations), 21.160.211 (Existing West Elevations), 21.160.PP3a.POS (Proposed Block Plan), 21.160.PP3a.400 (Proposed Site Plan), 21.160.PP3a.401 (Proposed Basement Plan), 21.160.PP3a.402 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan), 21.160.PP3a.403 (Proposed First Floor Plan), 21.160.PP3a.404 (Proposed Second Floor Plan), 21.160.PP3a.405 (Proposed Section AA), 21.160.PP3a.406 (Proposed Section BB), 21.160.PP3a.407 (Proposed Section CC), 21.160.PP3a.408 (Proposed Section DD), 21.160.PP3a.409 (Proposed Front Elevation), 21.160.PP3a.410 (Proposed Rear Elevation), 21.160.PP3a.411 (Proposed West Elevation), 21.160.PP3a.412 (Proposed East Elevation), 21.160.PP3a.413 (Proposed Garden Wall Elevation), Heritage Statement, April 2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The hereby approved one rooflight to the front, rear and rear outrigger roof slopes shall be Conservation style rooflight and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD.

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the approved plans shall be felled, uprooted, damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

If a tree marked on the tree report to be retained is removed without consent, or dying, or being severely damaged, or becoming seriously diseased (crown more than 50% sparse), within 5 years from the start of work on the development hereby permitted, a replacement tree shall be planted on the site or surrounding area reflecting the CAVAT value of the tree, or a proportion of its value reflecting the damage. This penalty shall be sought, unless the Local Planning Authority has given written consent to any variation.

Reason: to secure the protection throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of important amenity value to the local landscape.
description: Single storey rear extension; excavation to provide a basement level; construction of two storey outrigger (following the demolition of the existing two storey outrigger); alteration to first floor extension incorporating juliet balcony; alterations to first floor rear elevation fenestration; installation of one conservation style rooflight to front elevation roofslope  and one to rear elevation roofslope; construction of attached garage; removal of porch roof to front entrance; installation of heat pumps in rear garden; front boundary alterations; installation of a rooflight to the rear outrigger roofslope
